description.plain:
Louis William Tomlinson, born Louis Troy Austin on December 24th, 1991, is an English pop singer-songwriter also known for his work as part of British-Irish sensation One Direction. Like his bandmates, Louis auditioned as a solo act on X-Factor UK in 2010 before being put into the group. Although they only came in third place, the boys became an international success and made five full albums, (Up All Night, Take Me Home, Midnight Memories, FOUR, and Made In The A.M.). 1D began an indefinite hiatus in 2015, and the next year, Louis became a father to Freddie Reign Tomlinson. In December 2016, Louis' mother Johannah Deakin died of leukemia and Louis dedicated his first performance of his debut single “Just Hold On” — a collaboration with “Steve Aoki” — to her.

Louis released his second single “Back to You,” a collaboration with Bebe Rexha and Digital Farm Animals in July 2017. Two more singles, “Just Like You” and “Miss You,” were released later that year. In March 2019, Louis released the first song off of his debut album Walls, “Two of Us.” He picked up the Best Song Award at the 2019 Teen Choice Awards for this song, which has hit over 100 million streams on Spotify.

The album was released on January 31 2020. It reached #1 on Worldwide iTunes Album Chart and reached #1 on iTunes Album Chart in 50 countries. It debuted at #4 on the UK Official Charts, #2 for UK Official Album sales, #8 on Rolling Stones Top Albums Chart, and #9 on the Billboard 200 charts.

description.plain:
“Back To You” is the second song to be released by Louis Tomlinson as a solo artist following the December 2016 release of “Just Hold On.” On the day this song dropped, Louis told Heat this song isn’t closely related to him, because the whole album is very personal so it was nice to take the pressure off with this song. He also said in the same interview that the song represents “the most extreme situation of that kind of relationship”.

On June 24 Louis hinted at the release of a single in a tweet. Later that day he announced the title and revealed that Bebe Rexha and Digital Farm Animals would be featured in the song in another tweet. Following this announced that it would be released at the end of July before confirming the rumored release date of July 21 and releasing the single art. Later he revealed a lyric from the song before sharing clips of the song on his Instagram story and on Twitter.

“Back to You” has been certified Gold in the UK and Platinum in the US.

I know you say you know me, know me well

I always thought I'd be with someone else
I thought I would own the way I felt, yeah

[Pre-Chorus: Bebe Rexha]
I call you but you never even answer
I tell myself I'm done with wicked games
But then I get so numb with all the laughter

Oh, you stress me out, you kill me

I don't know how to make it stop
I love it, I hate it

[Bridge: Louis Tomlinson]

songs.full_title: Always You by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: Always You

description.plain:
“Always You” talks about the feeling that someone was meant to be with you, where everything seems to remind you of them. He confirmed it to be on his debut album on his #SpotifyFansFirst interview with Roman Kemp. Louis has mentioned in the same interview that it is personal to him, and his favorite song off of his album.

On August 24, 2017, Louis released a snippet on his Instagram containing lyrics that were later revealed to be part of the track. In a Q&A session with Crash Records, Louis explained that “Always You” made it on the album because of the fans:

The reason “Always You” stayed is that I teased 15 seconds of it on one of my socials years back and, ever since, the fans have been desperate to hear it. I owed them that one.

In an interview with The Sun, Louis described the track as a song about “traveling the world and just being a fucking idiot and going, ‘Of course it was always you’.”

songs.full_title: Only the Brave by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: Only the Brave

description.plain:
“Only the Brave” closes out the album suggesting that love is only for those who are brave and take risks. The track features a harsh-sounding acoustic guitar backed by a crackling sound that gives off a classic feel.

In October 2019, Louis stated that this was the only song of the album that he did not write on. In November 2019, the track was registered on ASCAP with Louis only listed as a performer, giving away that this would be the last track on the album. Louis does in fact have writing credits, as he later mentioned in an interview with Crash Records:

“Only the Brave” I think may have been written for Liam Gallagher. It’s the one song I didn’t write much on. It was played to me and I instantly adored it. There was talk of making it longer, but what’s great is that it’s so short, yet gets its message across so clearly.

songs.full_title: Defenceless by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: Defenceless

description.plain:
“Defenceless” continues the theme of vulnerability that is shown throughout the album, as Louis talks about the avoidance of discussing issues with a partner. The track features a light guitar melody paired with a lively beat.

The track was revealed after it was performed live at the Coca-Cola Music Experience in Madrid, Spain on September 14, 2019. On January 28, 2020, a snippet of the track was added to Spotify as a teaser.

In February 2021, a fan project was set up to get ‘Defenceless’ into the worldwide charts. It succeeded and was number 1 on the global iTunes chart, as well as being played on radios across the world and debuting at no. 32 on the UK Big Top 40 on 07/02/2021. Louis also acknowledged his fans on Twitter. https://twitter.com/Louis_Tomlinson/status/1357314114754916353?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1357314114754916353%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bigtop40.com%2Fnews%2Flouis-tomlinson-defenceless-chart-walls-fans%2F

songs.full_title: Two of Us by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: Two of Us

description.plain:
“Two of Us” is the fifth song released by Louis Tomlinson as a solo artist following the 2016 cut “Just Hold On” with Steve Aoki and 2017’s “Back To You” featuring Bebe Rexha and Digital Farm Animals, “Just Like You”, and “Miss You”. The song finds the singer both grappling with grief and striving towards hope amidst a swell of strings, piano, and booming drums.

Tomlinson has previously been very private about the death of his mother, Johannah Pulston Deakin back in December 2016 but has now released a song about the impact it had on him, telling BBC Radio 1’s Newsbeat, quote:

I’m not at the stage in my grief where I’m going to open the first verse and burst into tears.

body.plain:
“Two of Us” is the fifth song released by Louis Tomlinson as a solo artist following the 2016 cut “Just Hold On” with Steve Aoki and 2017’s “Back To You” featuring Bebe Rexha and Digital Farm Animals, “Just Like You”, and “Miss You”. The song finds the singer both grappling with grief and striving towards hope amidst a swell of strings, piano, and booming drums.

Tomlinson has previously been very private about the death of his mother, Johannah Pulston Deakin back in December 2016 but has now released a song about the impact it had on him, telling BBC Radio 1’s Newsbeat, quote:

I’m not at the stage in my grief where I’m going to open the first verse and burst into tears.

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
It's been a minute since I called you
Just to hear the answerphone
Yeah, I know that you won't get this
But I'll leave a message so I'm not alone
This morning I woke up still dreaming
With memories playing through my head
You'll never know how much I miss you
The day that they took you, I wish it was me instead

[Pre-Chorus]

You can do it day by day"
And diamonds, they don't turn to dust or fade away

[Chorus]

I'll be living one life for the two of us
I will be the best of me, always keep you next to me
I'll be living one life for the two of us
Even when I'm on my own, I know I won't be alone
Tattooed on my heart are the words of your favourite song
I know you'll be looking down, swear I'm gonna make you proud
I'll be living one life for the two of us

[Verse 2]
I can feel your blood run through me
You're written in my DNA
Looking back in every mirror
I know you'll be waiting, I'll see you again

[Pre-Chorus]
But you once told me, "Don't give up
You can do it day by day"
And diamonds, they don't turn to dust or fade away (Fade away)

[Chorus]
So I will keep you, day and night, here until the day I die
I'll be living one life for the two of us
I will be the best of me, always keep you next to me

Even when I'm on my own, I know I won't be alone
Tattooed on my heart are the words of your favourite song
I know you'll be looking down, swear I'm gonna make you proud
I'll be living one life for the two of us

[Bridge]
I promised you I'd do this
So all of this is all for you
Oh, I swear to God you're living
Through everything I'll ever do

[Chorus]
So I will keep you, day and night, here until the day I die
I'll be living one life for the two of us
I will be the best of me, always keep you next to me
I'll be living one life for the two of us
Even when I'm on my own, I know I won't be alone
Tattooed on my heart are the words of your favourite song
I know you'll be looking down, swear I'm gonna make you proud
I'll be living one life for the two of us

Just you and me and no one else

songs.full_title: Miss You by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: Miss You

description.plain:
“Miss You” is a track by British singer-songwriter Louis Tomlinson. The song is included as a bonus track on the Japanese version of Tomlinson’s debut album, Walls.

In an interview with TellyMix, Tomlinson discussed the inspiration behind the song:

I wrote this song about a time in my life when I was going out partying every night. In hindsight, throughout that time I was pretty numb and just going through the motions. Deep down, it was always in the back of my mind that what I really missed was the girl that I loved.

songs.full_title: Too Young by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: Too Young

description.plain:
“Too Young” is an acoustic track that talks about being in love with someone at a young age and thinking you are going to spend the rest of your life with them, yet being too young to understand the responsibility that comes love.

The track was debuted live for SiriusXM on October 25, 2019. A snippet of the track was added to Spotify as a teaser on January 28, 2020.

songs.full_title: Copy of a Copy of a Copy by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: Copy of a Copy of a Copy
songs.title_with_featured: Copy of a Copy of a Copy

description.plain:
“Copy of a Copy of a Copy” was first teased in a promo video and later in a tweet a few days before Louis' livestreamed charity concert. After speculation from some fans that it was “Copy Of A”, by Nine Inch Nails, Tomlinson tweeted revealing that it was a new song, not a cover. The song is rumored to be about him talking to his younger self.

He then performed it for the first time on the show after announcing it in the setlist. This was also the first time it was publicly heard.

He later revealed in a tweet that he was not sure if it will be released as a part of his second studio album, but it would remain in the set for tour.

songs.full_title: Fearless by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: Fearless

description.plain:
“Fearless” is a message to the youth of today to live your life without fear and to never measure your self-worth based on money or the opinion of others.

The title was revealed on January 2, 2020, when Louis replied to a fan on Twitter who asked for the title of the ninth track on the album.

songs.full_title: Habit by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: Habit

description.plain:
“Habit” sees Louis talk about being so devoted to a person that any tension and issues they have aren’t enough for him to stop loving them. Louis also recalls on certain times in his life, including living at Princess Park in London with his One Direction bandmates in 2012.

The track was revealed after it was performed live at the Coca-Cola Music Experience in Madrid, Spain on September 14, 2019. On January 30, 2020, a snippet of the track was added to Spotify as a teaser.

That mentally, you were already out the door

[Pre-Chorus]

But God, I'm missing you and your addictive heart

[Chorus]
You're the habit that I can't break
You're the feelin' I can't put down
You're the shiver that I can't shake
You're the habit that I can't break
You're the high that I need right now
You're the habit that I can't break

[Verse 2]
I took some time 'cause I've ran out of energy
Of playing someone I heard I'm supposed to be
But honestly, I don't have to choose anymore

songs.full_title: Walls by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: Walls

description.plain:
“Walls” is the title track and final promotional single released on Louis Tomlinson’s debut album, Walls. Lyrically, the track talks about the challenges of life and relationships, and how they make you stronger in the long run.

Similarly to the previous singles, it features a heavy guitar influence, this time accompanied by light drums and an orchestra in the background.

The opening and closing line was revealed by Louis in an interview on November 6, 2019. The following month, a snippet of the track was played at the end of the music video for “Don’t Let It Break Your Heart,” the previously released single. The release date was revealed by Louis on social media on January 15, 2020, with a video of an orchestra playing the track.

songs.title: Perfect Now

description.plain:
“Perfect Now” sees Louis telling a shy, unconfident lover that they are perfect the way they are, even on their worst days. The track features a dulcet guitar tone backed by a light melody.

The track was first discovered in October 2019 after it was registered on ASCAP, with a snippet of the track being added to Spotify as a teaser on January 29, 2020.

songs.full_title: Don’t Let It Break Your Heart by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: Don’t Let It Break Your Heart
songs.title_with_featured: Don’t Let It Break Your Heart

description.plain:
“Don’t Let It Break Your Heart” is the fourth promotional single released on Louis Tomlinson’s debut album, Walls. It features a light guitar melody, which builds up to a lively chorus introducing the drums.

The song was first performed at the Coca-Cola Music Experience 2019 in Madrid, Spain on September 14, 2019. The release date was revealed on November 21, 2019, through a Spotify playlist, where the first word of each track spelt out the title.

The song was officially released on November 23, 2019, right before Louis' performance of the song for the X Factor: Celebrity Semi-Final was aired.

songs.full_title: We Made It by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: We Made It

description.plain:
“We Made It” is a pop-punk ballad that sees Louis talk about the collective feeling of success in the choruses, and young romance in the verses.

As the third promotional single of Walls, it features a heavy distorted guitar influence, similar to the sound of Oasis. In an interview with Billboard, Louis mentioned that Oasis were a big part of him when he was younger, so “naturally their influence is woven in there.”

Louis announced the song across his social media accounts on the October 20, 2019, with the title being teased back in July and a snippet of the track being shared on Instagram in February.

songs.full_title: Just Like You by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: Just Like You

description.plain:
“Just Like You” is a promotional single released by Louis Tomlinson. It’s his first song without a feature on it. A lyric video was released on October 17, 2017.

On his social media accounts, Louis said:

So I wrote a song called Just Like You a few months ago. After a few conversations with the label I told them that I wanted to release it. My next single will be a bit later this year but I wanted to share this with you now.

In an interview with Zane Lowe on Beats 1 Radio, Tomlinson called “Just Like You” autobiographical:

The fans have seen so much and got to know us so well, but I’ve never really had a chance to be as honest like that with music. So that was really refreshing … It was just important for me to write a song that could humanize me as much as possible, and that the fans could really feel like I’m just like them – honest and vulnerable and real.

songs.title: Kill My Mind

description.plain:
“Kill My Mind” is the second promotional single released on Louis Tomlinson’s debut solo album, Walls. Differing from previously released singles on the album, the track features rasp vocals that accompany the upbeat drums and guitar to deliver a ‘90s indie-pop style track.

The track was officially announced one week prior to its release date via social media, with Louis posting the “KMM” title abbreviation two days before.

songs.full_title: Bigger Than Me by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: Bigger Than Me

description.plain:
As the lead single from Louis Tomlinson’s sophomore studio album, Faith in the Future, “Bigger Than Me” finds itself as an anthemic pop/rock song, on which Tomlinson sings about letting go of self-doubt, personal growth and shutting down the negative voices.

The song was announced on August 31, 2022, alongside an official teaser, to be released the next day. A music video for it was released exactly 24 hours later, on September 2, 2022.

songs.full_title: Silver Tongues by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: Silver Tongues

description.plain:
“Silver Tongues” is the third single from Louis Tomlinson’s second album, Faith in the Future. It was released alongside a lyric video for the song.
The song is about the exhilarating moments spent with someone who completely understands you, though the outside world does not understand (or is not aware) of your connection. Tomlinson expresses a desire to stay in these moments with the person, saying “I don’t feel like going home.”
To have a silver tongue means to have “a tendency to be eloquent and persuasive in speaking.” Silver Tongues is also the title of a 2011 film in which two lovers move from place to place while dangerously deceiving one another.

songs.full_title: Written All Over Your Face by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: Written All Over Your Face

description.plain:
Written All Over Your Face is the 2nd track off of Faith in the Future. This song has punk like elements and was inspired by the Arctic Monkeys first 2 albums according to the interview he did with Euphoria. “I suppose that’s where the Arctic Monkeys reference comes from; there are obviously punk elements within what they do.”

This song explains how Louis sees the misfortune of this relationship, and can tell his partner sees it as well.

songs.title: Change

description.plain: “Change” was first performed at The Away From Home Festival 2021, where Louis also announced that it would be included in his sophomore album alongside another then unreleased song titled “Copy of a Copy of a Copy”, but neither made the cut. In late May 2023, the song was officially available on all streaming platforms, as part of Faith In The Future (Bonus Edition), which was previously available temporarily on Tomlinson’s digital store in November 2022.

songs.full_title: Face the Music by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: Face the Music

description.plain:
On “Face the Music” Louis Tomlinson speaks of a couple who know they are bad for each other, or at least know that there would be consequences to them being together; but ultimately not caring about it, and submitting to their love for one another.
FTM is told through by a first-person narrator, presumably Louis, and his inner monologue and subsequent debate of right and wrong; where wanting this person puts him in the world, and wether or not it all is so bad in the end.
 On this track, the narrator wants the best of both worlds, seemingly unable to choose between this person, and the consequences being with them would bring. But ultimately submitting to this person at the end of the song; stating that, for just one night, he won’t have this debate with himself, forget about the worries and wrong this relationship will bring him, and just go with it.

  Face the music is the fifth track on Louis Tomlinson second album, Faith in the Future.

songs.full_title: Headline by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: Headline

description.plain:
Headline is track 9 on Louis Tomlinson 2nd album “Faith In The Future”. According to Louis’s twitter, this was the last recorded song for this album.

On this track, Louis uses imagery of a headline to explain why him and his love interest didn’t work out.

songs.full_title: That's the Way Love Goes by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: That’s the Way Love Goes

description.plain:
“I think it’s an interesting story, an interesting visual going through the song,” said Louis Tomlinson about “That’s The Way Love Goes”, the album’s closer. “With the way the album is structured, it kind of fits nicely to finish on that message. I wouldn’t have been able to do that on the first album because there weren’t enough peak moments of energy.”

Louis wrote this song for a friend, probably his best friend Oli Wright who he has known since their childhood in Doncaster.

songs.full_title: Common People by Louis Tomlinson
songs.title: Common People

description.plain:
In Common People Louis pays tribute to his hometown Doncaster.
Doncaster is a city in South Yorkshire, England; in which Louis grew up. He always mentioned how much this place shaped him as who he is today. In the song he shows a nostalgic tone, he talks about the simple people who live there.

description.plain:
Louis' lively single gets twisted into a dark, deep-house rendition (Now with more drop!) as he teams up once more with Digital Farm Animals to remix the hit, two weeks after the original dropped.

The track oddly received almost no promotion or coverage except for a few tweets from DFA themselves, possibly because of Bebe’s own release of her single “That’s It” on the same day.

https://twitter.com/DigiFarmAnimals/status/892877514829332481
